result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Dean Clay II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of costs 9 days jail consecutive to count 1 and concurrent to any other sentence now serving.
concurrent to any other sentence now serving

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert Dean Clay in court in custody with attorney Ryan W O'Hara.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty. Court orders 30 days jail concurrent to any other sentence now serving. In lieu of costs 9 days jail consecutive to count 1 and concurrent to sentence currently serving. Sentence credit 1 day. Count 2 dismissed and read in.
Attorney Ryan W O'Hara in court.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Writ to be prepared by attorney O'Hara.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Ryan W O'Hara in court.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody at Green Bay Correctional Institution.  Attorney O'Hara to prepare Writ.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Faun Michelle Moses in court.  Mark Matthew Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Attorney Moses to prepare writ.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Attorney Faun Michelle Moses in court.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant Robert Dean Clay in court with attorney Faun Michelle Moses.  Mark Matthew Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Robert Dean Clay in court in custody with attorney Faun Michelle Moses.  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $750 set.   Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim HJ (elder & younger), their residences, places of employment, vehicles, or elsewhere.  No contact 1613 Vine St or 1516 8th St, Beloit, WI.  Must provide a current address to the COC address within 48 hours of release.  Absolute Sobriety ordered.
